quotes: We are here because George Floyd is not.
If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor.
Racism is not getting worse, it’s getting filmed.
As long as people can be judged by the color of their skin, the problem is not solved.
It is never too late to give up your prejudices.
A riot is the language of the unheard.
I keep my ideals, because in spite of everything I still believe that people are really good at heart.
For it isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
If you want peace, work for justice.
When all Americans are treated as equal, no matter who they are or whom they love, we are all more free.
Stand up for what you believe in, even if it means standing alone.
Ignorance is stubborn and prejudice is hard.
Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
Laundry is the only thing that should be separated by color.
People only see what they are prepared to see.
We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
All lives can't matter until black lives matter.
Gentle reminder that this doesn’t end today or tomorrow or after you post about it once
We all have a responsibility to educate ourselves and end this hate.
You can’t play ignorance, justified by feeling uncomfortable, when Black people have been made to feel uncomfortable their entire lives in a white privileged, systematically racist and unfair society
If you don’t know what else to do, every little bit helps.
The only crime he committed was being Black and beautiful.
